items.name: Big Family Planting in Las Rozas 2024

fields.event-name: Big Family Planting in Las Rozas 2024
fields.event_details:
The first open event of the European Tree Planting Day was a massive success! Around 1200 people participated not only in the ecological restoration of the area, but could also enjoy the cultural shows and environmental workshops that were held by the Las Rozas City Hall.

Our fourth year of collaboration in a row, and making it more successfull and unique every time! Thanks to all participants and the Las Rozas municipality for the amazing job!
fields.subscription_instructions: People can join freely by attending the event during the designated hours. It starts at 10:00am and lasts for around 5 hours. Find more information in the Las Rozas Municipality webpage: https://www.lasrozas.es/node/10799

fields.event_details: Cada clase de 3 años va a plantar un abeto para que vayan viendo su crecimiento durante la escolarizacion

items.name: Hélicon reforesta el parque Adolfo Suárez Valdemoro

fields.event-name: Hélicon reforesta el parque Adolfo Suárez Valdemoro
fields.event_details:
El pasado 13 de diciembre, en un esfuerzo por fomentar la conciencia ambiental y la participación comunitaria, Ecoescuela Hélicon llevó a cabo una plantación de árboles en el parque Adolfo Suárez de Valdemoro. Este evento no solo ha sido una oportunidad para embellecer nuestro entorno, sino también para involucrar a los estudiantes en acciones concretas contra la crisis climática.

La actividad ha sido posible gracias a la colaboración del Ayuntamiento de Valdemoro, que ha facilitado una zona del parque y ha proporcionado veinte árboles, entre encinas y pinos carrascos. Esta colaboración es un bonito ejemplo del trabajo conjunto entre instituciones para promover la educación ambiental.

La plantación se enmarca dentro del Proyecto Europeo Life Terra, en colaboración con ADEAC (Asociación de Educación Medioambiental y del Consumidor), que es responsable en España de los programas internacionales de la Foundation for Environmental Education (FEE).

En el acto participaron los ecodelegados del Comité Ambiental, quienes representaron a cada uno de los cursos de la ESO y Bachillerato, junto con un grupo de alumnos de Primaria de los niveles de 4º a 6º, (en total 60 alumnos), y fueron acompañados por 6 profesores.

Además, se contó con la presencia del Alcalde, el Concejal de Medio Ambiente y el responsable de Parques y Jardines de Valdemoro, lo que también subraya la importancia de la colaboración entre la educación y la administración local.

Este importante acontecimiento ha servido también para marcar el inicio de una nueva andadura para Ecoescuela Hélicon, cuyo hilo conductor a lo largo de este curso será LOS BOSQUES alineándose con el ODS 15 "Vida en los ecosistemas terrestres", dedicado a promover el uso sostenible de los ecosistemas terrestres, luchar contra la desertificación, detener e invertir la degradación de las tierras y frenar la pérdida de la diversidad biológica.

Esta jornada no solo fue una lección sobre el medio ambiente, sino también una experiencia que unió a los alumnos de distintas edades y les enseñó el valor del trabajo en equipo. Sin duda un día memorable que quedará grabado en sus corazones y que les inspirará a seguir cuidando nuestro planeta.

Queremos agradecer a todos los que han hecho posible este evento y a quienes se sumen a esta noble causa. ¡Juntos podemos hacer la diferencia!

items.name: ABN AMRO tree planting event at Mariënwaerdt

fields.event-name: ABN AMRO tree planting event at Mariënwaerdt
fields.event_details: Squally rain and loads of mud didn't stop ABN Amro, plus teams from Life Terra and Land Life Company. from planting [500?] trees at the Mariënwaerdt estate at the end of November! The challenging conditions brought out the best in everyone, and the volume of mud was often hilarious. Nobody went home clean, but they did go home happy, refreshed and satisfied by a bracing day of tree planting and the renewal of woodland devastated by Ash Dieback. Congratulations and thank you, ABN Amro!

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Het Kleverland

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Het Kleverland
fields.event_details: Het Kleverland is an agro-ecological, regenerative food garden located in the Netherlands. The initiative focuses on sustainable farming practices aimed at restoring the land's ecosystem while producing food. For further details, visit their website directly. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. On December 1, 2024, a planting day was organized to plant several trees and fruit trees.

In December 2024, Zwaluweveld participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting around 300 small trees and shrubs. A planting event was held on December 7 and 8, 2024, inviting community members to contribute to the establishment of the food forest.

items.name: Planting trees with Tulpenrallye at Mariënwaerdt

fields.event-name: Planting trees with Tulpenrallye at Mariënwaerdt
fields.event_details:
On a crisp November morning under a bright sun, members of Tulpenrallye joined the Life Terra team in the field to plant trees at Mariënwaerdt estate. In the days up to the planting event it had rained heavily, so the participants had to deal with a muddy field with large puddles of water and ice and hardened soil here and there. They weren’t phased by these tough conditions and managed to plant around 250 trees! Thank you members of Tulpenrallye, for this amazing effort that helps this part of the Mariënwaerdt estate recover from Ash Dieback disease.

Tulpenrallye, organiser of the Dutch annual car rally event of the same name, is planting a total of 3,500 trees in partnership with Life Terra, to offset all CO2 emissions from the 70th edition.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Ecodorp land van aine

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Ecodorp land van aine
fields.event_details:
Ecodorp Land van Aine is an ecovillage project located in Ter Apel, Netherlands, dedicated to transforming a neglected industrial site into a sustainable community featuring vegetable gardens, herb gardens, a food forest, small-scale enterprises, and approximately 30 to 50 eco-friendly homes. In November 2024, Ecodorp Land van Aine participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for establishing food forests on their grounds, particularly around their camping areas and ponds.

A planting event was organized on Saturday, November 16, 2024, where participants planted various fruit trees and berry bushes and received information on creating and maintaining a food forest.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Benthuizen

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Benthuizen
fields.event_details:
In November 2024, Voedselbos Benthuizen participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting additional trees and shrubs. With community support, a planting day was held on November 29, 2024, inviting people to contribute to the growth and development of the food forest.

The food forest serves as a source of inspiration, demonstrating that nature and agriculture can go hand in hand while helping restore biodiversity and supporting pollinators.

items.name: Afternoon tree planting event with EY

fields.event-name: Afternoon tree planting event with EY
fields.event_details: Two teams from EY joined us on one day in late November at the Mariënwaerdt Estate to replant a forest that had been destroyed by Ash Dieback disease. In contrast to the week of rain preceding it, the day dawned bright and clear and it was a pleasure to be out in nature, in winter sunshine, backdropped by birdsong. The EY teams together planted [1000?] young trees, which are now standing in neat rows where previously just stumps and scrub existed. In just a few years, these will mature into an enchanting and hardy mixed woodland, bursting with biodiversity. Thank you EY and we look forward to planting with you again soon!

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Alblasserdam

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Alblasserdam
fields.event_details: In November 2024, Voedselbos Alblasserdam participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators for the addition of around 100 trees and shrubs. On November 30, a planting event was held, where community members were invited to assist in planting new trees and shrubs, further contributing to the growth and development of the food forest.

items.name: One Tree Planted event with DLL near Den Bosch

fields.event-name: One Tree Planted event with DLL near Den Bosch
fields.event_details: A big and enthusiastic group of 50 people from DLL made a significant impact on the flourishing Levensbomenbos near Den Bosch. Thanks to their hard work and energy, the job was done really quickly. The rain started right after the planting was finished—just in time to enjoy some warm drinks and food. It was the perfect way to wrap up the 2024 events.

Hallo! Wij zijn Mirte, Evi en Kristof, en samen dromen we van een groener Haspengouw. Help jij mee om onze droom werkelijkheid te maken?

Wat kun je verwachten op 24 november?

• Bomen planten: De bomen die we samen dankzij de crowdfunding mogelijk hebben gemaakt. Wij voorzien schoppen, maar je mag zeker ook je eigen materiaal meenemen. Denk aan een schop, laarzen, en voor de kinderen kan een emmertje en een klein schupje leuk zijn om mee te helpen!

• Eten en drinken: Bij de start om 10:00 uur kun je genieten van een croissant met koffie of water. ’s Middags voorzien we voor elke deelnemer twee broodjes met koffie of water.

• Geleide wandeling: Ontdek het natuurgebied met een gids die je alles vertelt over de unieke flora en fauna in Helshoven.

• Gezellige voorzieningen: Er is een tentje waar je even kunt uitrusten en samenkomen met andere deelnemers.

Datum: Zondag 24 november 2024

Locatie: Helshovenstraat, Borgloon

Tijd: 10:00 – 14:00 uur

Parkeren: Er is parkeergelegenheid langs de Helshovenstraat.

Kom samen met ons deze dag beleven en draag je steentje bij aan een groener Borgloon!

Im Rahmen der Umgestaltung des Eichtalparks zum Klimapark in Wandsbek hat Citizens Forests e. V. gemeinsam mit dem Bezirksamt Wandsbek und dem Projektbüro Superurban eine Knickerweiterung gepflanzt. Nach der Miyawaki-Methode wurde mit sowohl heimischen als auch erstmalig auf Wunsch des Bezirksamtes mit exotischen Baum- und Straucharten gepflanzt.
fields.subscription_instructions: Complete registration with this link or go to website: https://www.citizens-forests.org/buchung/

items.name: MIYA forest e.V. Tiny Forest in Rüsselsheim, Germany

Start is 8.30 am and it goes until the last tree is planted, so maybe until 5.30 pm.

items.name: Agora Portals International School planting tree day!!

fields.event-name: Agora Portals International School planting tree day!!
fields.event_details:
Today, our two classes of 5-year-old students arrived at the designated planting area near the entrance of our school, so we expect them to show their parents and show them their tree.

They were thrilled to see our gardener, Juanma, prepared with the trees, soil, gloves, shovels, watering cans, and everything needed for the planting activity.

Once there, we asked the children why trees are so important and what they need to live. A variety of enthusiastic answers emerged: “They need water,” “They give us fruit”, “They don’t like plastic,” and “They clean the air.”

After this discussion, all the students helped Juanma by adding soil around the trees and stamping the ground to keep it firm. Some even picked up bits of litter they found nearby, proudly declaring that the trees wouldn’t like that. It was a wonderful day of learning and teamwork, and we can’t wait to watch our trees grow!

What a day to remember! Life Terra hosted our first tree-planting event with NVIDIA near Munich! They support this plot with 1,000 new trees — a big thank you to NVIDIA for taking steps towards climate action and a greener future. Together we planted 200 trees and set up proper protectors around them.

Thanks to a fantastic fundraising campaign, NVIDIANs joined us for an incredible day in the forest, combining nature, teamwork, and a dose of wellbeing. From boosting mental health to building stronger connections with colleagues, this event truly had it all.

Welcome, NVIDIA, to the Life Terra family as our newest business supporter for climate action! Let’s keep growing together.

El evento se ha llevado a cabo dentro de nuestro centro en dos fases. La primera de ellas ha sido la fase de motivación, el día de la plantación se hizo un cuentacuentos , basado "Un árbol", un cuento que nos muestra como a veces una pequeña decisión es suficiente para transformar todo lo que nos rodea, y eso es lo que ocurre cuando Alina planta un árbol, finalizamos la representación con una canción en la que participamos todos.

Este cuentacuentos se lleva a cabo en una de nuestras salas múltiples en la que estuvimos las tres clases de 1-2 años y las tres clases de 2.3 años, además del equipo educativo y las familias que no se quisieron perder este día.

Después salimos a l exterior y nos organizamos un poco para repartirnos, de manera que la plantación de los tres árboles estuviera cubierta tanto con niños como con adultos para ayudar. Los peques participaron muy activamente con sus manos y palas para cubrir los agujeros y acomodar los árboles, agujeros que previamente, nos habían dejado preparados nuestros compañeros del Ayuntamiento de San Sebastián de los Reyes de "Parques y jardines".

Fue un día muy bonito y emocionante que ha sido muy bien valorado tanto por familias como por el equipo educativo, además en torno a está plantación y a estos tres árboles también se llevarán a cabo diferentes propuestas durante este curso.

La mañana finalizó con nuestro "Almuerzo saludable" que como no podía ser de otra manera fueron unas ricas manzanas y peras.
Realizar plantación de árboles autóctonos en el IES Luis Buñuel de Alcorcón, con la colaboración de la Concejalía de Parques y Jardines del Ayuntamiento.

items.name: Kicking off the planting season in Limburg with BLG!

fields.event-name: Kicking off the planting season in Limburg with BLG!
fields.event_details:
During our first event at the Unesco World Heritage location of De Maasheggen, we planted around 700 trees with our partner BLG. Despite the snow, the participants were able to plant a beautiful new hedge that will contribute to this unique and biodiverse ecosystem.

This project close to the village of Oeffelt was organised by Maasheggen Mooi. This is an initiative by Lars van Peij, who has sadly been diagnosed with Huntington disease. He is therefore trying to plant as many new hedges as possible, to have a positive legacy for his son and the area he will grow up in.

We are very happy to be able to support this amazing effort. Please check out Maasheggen Mooi to help Lars with this beautiful initaitive. We also want to thank BLG for all their efforts during this lovely tree planting event.

Nuestra plantación fue muy entrañable, cada alumn@ llevó un tarrito de yogur lleno de tierra (salida del compost conseguido en la escuela), un padre de un alumno nos ayudó a plantar el pequeño árbol una vez que los alumn@s hecho cada uno su tarrito de tierra. Durante la plantación nos acompañó una pequeña banda de músicos compuesta por cinco familias.

El padre que nos ayudó a plantar el pequeño árbol (Arce de Monpelier) trabaja en una ONG en Africa, Tanzania, que ayuda a plantar árboles, es una asociación que trabaja con niñ@s de esa zona en colaboración con la Fundación de Wangari Maathai, política y ecologista keniana. Con ell@s intercambiamos unos pequeños vídeos, primero ellos nos mandaron un pequeño vídeo plantando un árbol, el día que plantamos nuestro pequeño árbol compartimos con ell@s nuestra plantación.

Tanto los adultos como los alumn@s disfrutamos mucho del evento, fue un gran día.

Esperamos y deseamos que nuestro pequeño árbol crezca sano, fuerte y llegue a cumplir mucho años en nuestra pequeña escuela.
Family bringing the trees, digging a hole and planting the tree.

items.name: Plantando frutales en el CEIP Eloy Saavedra

fields.event-name: Plantando frutales en el CEIP Eloy Saavedra
fields.event_details:
Cada árbol ha sido plantado por un grupo de 3º de primaria (participaron un total de 85 alumn@s, 25 por cada árbol, más los 4 tutores y la responsable del proyecto medioambiental). Además contamos con la colaboración del alumnado mayor, de 6º, que prepararon el terreno (15 alumn@s).

Los árboles se adquirieron en un Vivero cercano. Se dejaron un par de días en nuestro invernadero, para luego pasar a la plantación.

En el aula, cada grupo fue informado de lo que iba a plantar, y dónde.

Ya in situ, se hizo hincapié en el procedimiento práctico en sí, como tener en cuenta distancia entre ejemplares, riego del terreno, el alcorque, etc etc.

Una vez plantado, se informa de los cuidados, frecuencia de riego, cuándo puede dar frutos, etc..

En resumen, esta es la 1ª plantación de 4 frutales en el interior del centro (huerto de primaria), con el nivel de 3º implicado (85 alumn@s aprox), y otros de 6º en la preparación del terreno. (15 alumn@s de 6º). 100 alumn@s movilizados en esta intervención.

items.name: Free tree distribution from De Gezonde Stad Amsterdam!

fields.event-name: Free tree distribution from De Gezonde Stad Amsterdam!

fields.event_details: The Adax team joined us with incredible enthusiasm, bringing positive energy and a strong spirit for a day of planting in the forest. From the very start, everyone immersed themselves in the experience, sharing laughs, enjoying the fresh air, and working together to plant 600 birch trees—a fantastic contribution to our mission! After the hard work, we gathered for tea and cookies, savoring a warm, cozy break in the heart of nature. It was truly inspiring to see such teamwork and dedication, and we’re beyond grateful for their support. We can’t wait to welcome the Adax team back next year to continue growing this forest together!

Myliu Miską is organising a tree planting event to help green our local area and promote environmental sustainability! Together, we’ll plant trees, restore nature, and make a lasting positive impact for future generations.

In a joint project with the Evangelische Stiftung Alsterdorf, we will plant the first part of a small, new forest at Gut Stegen. As always, we will be planting native trees using the Miyawaki method.

We’re seeking volunteers to help us dig!

Please note: The area is somewhat hidden and not easily accessible by public transport. Please park only in the designated parking area, as there are no spaces directly at the planting site.

We plan to complete the project over several planting campaigns, so

come be part of this green initiative and help us grow a vibrant, native forest! 🌳
fields.subscription_instructions: Fill out the registration form here: https://www.citizens-forests.org/buchung/ .Shortly before the planting event, we will send the details to everyone who has registered by email.

fields.event_details: Vamos a realizar plantación de especies tanto en los patios y recintos del colegio como en el campo de futbol adyacente. La plantación tendrá lugar el 29 de noviembre (si el clima lo permite)

items.name: Training young Terra Leaders in Las Rozas

fields.event-name: Training young Terra Leaders in Las Rozas
fields.event_details:
The planting activity was a great success! A sunny day was the perfect environment to train these young volunteers, who assisted the Great Family Planting of Las Rozas 2024 and helped not only to pleant but also to tag the trees.

Great job! We hope to see you again in the field soon.

items.name: there for trees - Planting with kids in Domat/Ems

fields.event-name: there for trees - Planting with kids in Domat/Ems
fields.event_details: In beautiful weather, the children took part in a special planting day, where trees were planted, and climate action was discussed. The entire event unfolded in a joyful atmosphere—with many beaming children excited to get involved. All plants were successfully set in the ground, and each child had the opportunity to actively participate. The teacher was especially pleased, witnessing the children's enthusiasm, and at the end, expressed her excitement about making this an annual event. It was an inspiring day that brought young people closer to nature conservation, one they will hopefully remember for a long time.

items.name: there for trees - Planting with kids in Reichenbach

fields.event-name: there for trees - Planting with kids in Reichenbach
fields.event_details: there for trees is collaborating with the local forestry team and students to create a climate-resilient, future-proof forest. Together with classes from Reichenbach, we will enhance the forest edge, planting a variety of species that promote biodiversity and strengthen the forest’s climate resilience. Over two days, a total of 500 shrubs and trees will be planted.

During our first collaboration with Mapletree in Poland, we've planted 1000 trees near the Narew river, close to Warsaw! This new riparian forest will increase the biodiversity on the flood plane close to the river, as we've planted 5 native species that are adapted to thriving in wet conditions. This new forest will become part of Mapletree's European reforestation efforts, together with our planting projects in the UK and the Netherlands!

Durante el primer trismestre estuvimos trabajando con la clase de 3º de primaria los árboles de nuestro colegio. Como producto final hicimos un inventario de árboles del centro. Después de ese trabajo se hizo un sondeo de que tipo de árboles nuevos querrían plantar. Y así fue como se decidió la plantación de árboles frutales.

La activiad fue muy diertida y participativa. Cada clase plantó su árbol.

PMO bridge organizes events for project managers and instead of giving a goodie bag, they support NGO Myliu miska and in their name they plant a tree! So this saturday we had an honour to plant the trees!

items.name: Ecological restoration continues in Santa Clara a Velha

fields.event-name: Ecological restoration continues in Santa Clara a Velha
fields.event_details:
The Santa Clara a Velha Ecological Restoration project is Life Terra's biggest project in Portugal, with more than 65 ha restored using 7 different species.

This project aims to restore a former exhausted eucalyptus monoculture and transform the land into a biodiverse food forest. This will allow for soil recovery, natural regeneration, defragmentation of the habitat, and it will also produce fruit and pine nuts for the landowner as a form of revenue.

Furthermore, this project is certified for carbon removal and biodiversity credits, and this winter's plantation aimed to plant 7.500 plants as a way to make up for the mortality of the previous years.

This area suffers from intense droughts in summer, and the previous exhausted soils and the presence of wild boars makes the planting of new saplings in the first years a necessity in order to achieve our restoration goal. This shows that Life Terra's commitment to ecological restoration is a long-term view.

La actividad ha sido una experiencia muy enriquecedora. Además, ha estado vinculada a nuestro proyecto de innovación, en el que pretendemos repoblar una zona en la que teníamos muy poquita vegetación. Las familias y el profesorado se han implicado mucho, y los alumnos/as han valorado positivamente la actividad.

items.name: PLANTAMOS EN FAMILIA. E.I. ASERRÍN ASERRÁN

fields.event-name: PLANTAMOS EN FAMILIA. E.I. ASERRÍN ASERRÁN
fields.event_details: Se convocó a las familias de la escuela para realizar la plantación de árboles en el centro a través del correo electrónico y con cartelería. A las 16:00 h., tras recoger a sus hijos/as en las aulas, nos reunimos todos los participantes en el hall con el fin de repartir las tareas a realizar: cavar y hacer el agujero en las zonas elegidas en los patios, trasplantar los árboles, cubrir con tierra los cepellones, regar los árboles recién plantados. Participaron un total de 34 familias. Al finalizar compartimos todos un vaso de leche con galletas.

items.name: Creating a Woven Hedge at Boerderij Hartstocht near Abcoude

fields.event-name: Creating a Woven Hedge at Boerderij Hartstocht near Abcoude
fields.event_details: Chilly Dutch weather didn't deter a strong, hardy group of mariners and ship engineers during Reederei Nord's woven hedge planting event in Abcoude on 11th December! The group made swift progress along a 600m stretch of farmland, and soon the beginnings of the hedge were clear to see. We can't wait to see - and to share - how this hedge evolves to become a haven for local biodiversity, as well as a delicious source of fresh berries for local ramblers!

Our group helped the local nature association to plant this hedge in an agricultural area where biodiversity is usually very low. Children, adults, parents, friends and elderly people joined forces and planted these shrubs with a lot of fun and in record time!

La actividad finalmente fue muy, pero que muy bien. Al comienzo tuvimos algunos problemas logísiticos, como falta de herramientas, o que el ayuntamiento nos llevó albarrobos en lugar de encinas. Por tanto, las especies que etiquetamos como "desconocidas" son todas algarrobo. Esperamos poder arreglarlo posteriormente.

Operarios del servicio de jardinería nos llevaron a media mañana más herramientas para poder avanzar más rápido y al día siguiente fueron a poner puntos de goteo a todos los árboles plantados.

Por otro lado, los alumnos/as que parecían desmotivados se vinieron arriba y no había quien los parara (algunos no querían parar para desayunar) y siguieron plantando hasta el último segundo.

La zona en la que hemos hecho la reforestación era una antigua escombrera, transformada en zona verde del pueblo, junto a un ermita. En varias ocasiones desde el ayuntamiento han intentado ajardinar esa zona sin mucho éxito. Tras el análisis que hicimos desde el centro vimos que uno de los principales problemas era la densidad de conejo de campo en esa zona, por lo que decidimos poner protectores metálicos a todos los árboles.

Algunas propuestas de mejora son una mejor coordinación con la concejalía de jardines para el préstamo de herramientas, poder etiquetar plantas en la app con su nombre aunque no estuvieran en la lista prevista, y enterrar mejor los protectores metálicos que pusimos (ya que quedaron un poco endebles).

Queremos hacer un vídeo-resumen de la actividad pero por ahora no hemos tenido tiempo, te paso el enlace a la carpeta con fotos y vídeos del evento. https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tbn_BEKh4HFryLa_Gh29h7OkFgBmC6_P?usp=sharing

Si hay publicación agradeceríamos que se etiquete al Ayuntamiento de Águilas y al IES Europa.

Muchas gracias

items.name: Planting with the Green Helmets Project in Las Rozas

fields.event-name: Planting with the Green Helmets Project in Las Rozas
fields.event_details:
On Thursday 21 November, Cascos Verdes (Green Helmets) and employees from Amazon and Amazon Web Services gathered in Las Rozas, Madrid, to plant 150 trees and shrubs to restore the Dehesa de Navalcarbón.

The planting took place alongside a local school, Colegio Zola, where employees and students learned not only about planting but also about local species and the importance of caring for the environment.

The Green Helmets initiative aims to reforest and carry out work to improve the forest environment after the 2021 fires in Andalusia, south of Spain. Now, they are also expanding their reforestation efforts across the country.

We enjoyed the enthusiasm and energy of the Amazon employees, who, divided into groups, did amazing work hand in hand with the students.

At the end of the activity, and because we still had some time left, participants also learned about an insect hotel that is placed next to the planting site, which will help to attract pollinators and foster a healthier ecosystem around it.

We hope this will be the first of many collaborations!

Afterwards, we went to work and planted almost 200 trees that will become part of this more than 2000 meter long biodiverse hedge!

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Het Groente Genootschap

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Het Groente Genootschap
fields.event_details:
Het Groente Genootschap is a self-harvest garden located in Netherlands. It offers members the opportunity to weekly harvest local vegetables, herbs, and small fruits cultivated according to biological and ecological principles. The initiative emphasizes enhancing biodiversity, soil health, and fostering a strong local community.

In November 2024, Het Groente Genootschap participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, aiming to raise funds for planting a biodiverse hedge, additional fruit trees and shrubs, and initiating a potential future food forest. The planting event took place on November 26, 2024.
La actividad consistirá en plantar tres árboles (laurel, alcornoque y madroño) en un espacio del patio para iniciar su naturalización.

Mit den Schülern des Kronwerk-Gymnasiums wurden die ersten 400 Quadratmeter einer größeren Fläche bepflanzt. Das Projekt hat Citizens Forest e.V. in Zusammenarbeit mit dem BUND Rendsburg, den Seniortrainern Rendsburg, People for Future Rendsburg und dem Klimaforum Rendsburg durchgeführt.

items.name: Planting in The Green Rebel Farm with College Hageveld

fields.event-name: Planting in The Green Rebel Farm with College Hageveld
fields.event_details:
The planting activity at The Green Rebel farm in Miravet was an inspiring and hands-on experience for everyone involved. Over the five-day event, 24 students from College Hageveld, accompanied by three teachers, planted 200 trees in Hageveld’s Foodforest, continuing their tradition of planting one tree for each graduating student. The students worked enthusiastically, learning about regenerative agroforestry practices while preparing the soil with biochar, sowing fava beans, and adding mulch and cover crops to ensure the trees thrive in the challenging Mediterranean conditions.

The atmosphere was vibrant, with students enjoying the process of planting and gaining a deeper understanding of how these actions contribute to combating climate change. The weather was cooperative, with sunny days making the work enjoyable. In addition to planting, the group bonded over shared meals they prepared with fresh produce harvested from the farm, creating a strong connection to the land and to each other. This event not only added 200 more trees to the food forest but also planted seeds of awareness and hope in the minds of young people, empowering them to take action for a sustainable future.

fields.event_details: Worpse Weelde is a food forest initiative located on the border of Deventer in the Netherlands. The project aims to create a space where visitors can enjoy fruits, nuts, and herbs, fostering a connection with nature and promoting learning, collaboration, and enjoyment. In November 2024, Worpse Weelde participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting the first trees in their food forest. Planting days were scheduled for November 30, 2024, from 9:30 to 12:30, and on several Saturdays in December. Community members were invited to participate by bringing spades or shovels to assist with the planting activities.

The new Avenue of Freedom was established on Saturday, November 9th, in the Broumov region, where persecution of clergy from all over Czechoslovakia was concentrated during the previous communist regime. In the 1950s, an internment camp for priests and monks from various orders was set up in the local Benedictine monastery. By planting the Avenue of Freedom, we commemorated the past and expressed our respect for those who suffered and fought for our freedom.

The event is organized within the project „Planting Our Future”, supported by the International Visegrad Fund. Its aim is to exchange knowledge and experience in the field of tree planting and tree care programs in Poland, the Czech Republic and Slovakia.

Project partners: Fundusz Partnerstwa, Klub Gaja (Poland), Nadace Partnerství (Czechia), Nadácia Ekopolis (Slovakia).

The planting of the Avenue of Freedom takes place as part of the European Tree Planting Day initiative, which aims to unite communities, schools and environmental organisations across Europe to plant trees.

Initiative partners: Life Terra Foundation (Netherlands), Nadace Partnerství (Czechia).

“Lab Aberto fosters creativity and technological innovation in schools by establishing specialized laboratories. In these spaces, students build flying wings, autonomous cars and boats, and create objects using 3D printers with a variety of materials. Lab Aberto prepares students for the technological challenges of the future by engaging them in the artificial universe. However, Lab Aberto and its partner, Life Terra, believe that this admirable artificial world of the future will be even better when it is synergistically aligned with human nature and ecological sustainability.

On November 30th, the event began in the laboratory, with its coordinator, António Gonçalves, explaining the initiative and its objectives. Following this, 25 volunteers sowed cork oak acorns into small ceramic pots produced with a 3D printer. These seedlings will grow into saplings to be planted next year. Clara Araújo, representing ALTRI Florestal, and Renato Ferreira from the Municipality of Torres Vedras explained the entire process.

After the sowing activity, we moved to the field to plant strawberry trees. Lab Aberto aims to work increasingly at the intersection of forestry and technology. ALTRI, the Municipality of Torres Vedras, and Life Terra will continue to collaborate with Lab Aberto, and in a year, our cork oak saplings will be ready for planting.”

fields.event_details:
En una inspiradora jornada de acción climática, los alumnos de 6º de Primaria del Colegio Casvi Boadilla participaron activamente en el European Tree Planting Day. Como parte de los preparativos, los estudiantes aprendieron a identificar especies nativas adecuadas para el terreno de su escuela y sus alrededores. Utilizando aplicaciones como Pl@ntNet y consultando herramientas digitales como ARCGIS, seleccionaron cuidadosamente árboles adaptados al clima local evitando especies invasoras y considerando aquellas en peligro de extinción.

La actividad comenzó con dinámicas grupales que motivaron a los alumnos a reflexionar sobre el cambio climático y cómo sus acciones pueden contribuir al cuidado del medio ambiente. Tras la explicación teórica y demostración práctica realizada por los docentes, los estudiantes se dividieron en grupos pequeños para llevar a cabo la plantación. Equipados con palas y azadones, plantaron cuidadosamente los árboles (castaño, nogal, granado y níspero) siguiendo las instrucciones para asegurar su correcto crecimiento.

Para garantizar el seguimiento de los árboles plantados, cada ejemplar fue etiquetado utilizando la plataforma Life Terra. Los estudiantes registraron datos sobre las especies y ubicaciones mediante smartphones, integrándolos en el mapa global de Life Terra.

Echten - With a push of the green button, Albert Verlinde (chairman of the National Tree Planting Day Foundation), Inge Nieuwenhuizen (mayor of the municipality of De Wolden) and Sylvo Thijsen (director of Staatsbosbeheer) opened the 67th National Tree Planting Day today at Staatsbosbeheer-forest ranger's office Ruinen in Echten . During this green holiday, thousands of pupils throughout the Netherlands left their classrooms and went into their residential areas or nature to plant trees.

Donné Slangen, Director-General of Nature and Fisheries of the Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries, Food Security and Nature confirmed later that day the importance of nature education for all children. Together with a number of children, he planted a tree in the Ruinen forestry in the municipality of De Wolden (Drenthe). In doing so, he and all the other planters became, according to columnist Marcel van Ool, advisor on landscape and cultural history of Staatsbosbeheer, 'part of a miracle'.

Quinta da Penha Longa is a property close to Sintra and Cascais, well known for its natural and built heritage, but also for including the Caesar Park Penha Longa Golf Resort Hotel and a set of residential areas. On the forest area of Quinta da Penha Longa, Caesar Park is developing an ambitious program of rewilding and control of invasive species. In 2023, Life Terra had the opportunity to organize, together with Caesar Park, a planting event associated with this program.

The idea that citizens should be involved in rewilding processes is the central idea of the Life Terra project. This is also the central idea of the event to be held on December 10th at Quinta da Penha Longa, where residents together with the company's employees will, once again, participate directly in the planting operations of native species included in the rewilding program. This event will have the support of Cascais Ambiente, the environment agency of the Cascais municipality

The Caesar Park’s transformative idea that the natural value of the forest space is an important dimension of the resort's quality, justifying relevant investments in its conservation, is also strongly associated with Life Terra's objectives and action in multiple areas in Europe.

items.name: Planting with Greenbookings at De Polderij

Together with the members of Greenbookings, Life Terra concluded the successful starting year of Greenbookings with a wonderful planting day at a very pleasant, sustainable event location; The Polderij in Maassluis. We worked on creating a food forest for the benefit of the local community and planted no fewer than 1,400 trees! It was an inspiring day full of collaboration, good conversations and involvement. In 2024, the members of Greenbookings have donated almost 5,000 trees together! We are grateful to Greenbookings for this fantastic partnership and the valuable contribution the members have made over the past year!

Since January 2024, Life Terra has been planting partner of Greenbookings, a foundation that helps the event and meeting industry to become more sustainable by planting trees. In addition, the foundation offers the event and meeting industry a platform to exchange and further develop sustainable ideas, knowledge and initiatives. This is how we build a green future together!

items.name: "Raíces por el Planeta" O "Roots for the Planet".

fields.event-name: "Raíces por el Planeta" O "Roots for the Planet".

Ha hecho buen tiempo durante la plantación, lo cual ha sido favorable para desarrollarla adecuadamente sin dificultades. Ha tenido lugar durante una sesión de 1h de la asignatura de operaciones agrarias, antes del recreo. La profesora que ha guiado la plantación ha sido la profesora de Operaciones Agrarias y Huerto, que ha explicado todo el proceso: desde elegir los almendros (que son perfectos para el clima de Madridejos) hasta cómo plantarlos y cuidarlos. Se les ha enseñado que los almendros no solo nos dan sombra y belleza, sino que también ayudan a limpiar el aire y mejoran la biodiversidad. Además, estos almendros nos permitirán en los próximos años obtener más almendras para hacer las recetas que solemos realizar con ellas todos los años.

Se puede ver la actividad en nuestro blog: https://cpeemingolivamadridejos.blogspot.com/2024/12/plantacion-raices-por-el-planeta.html

Nada menos que 100 árboles y arbustos de 7 especies diferentes ¡Siendo únicamente 7 personas!

items.name: Planting of virtually user-purchased trees in Radomyśl

fields.event-name: Planting of virtually user-purchased trees in Radomyśl
fields.event_details:
We are happy to announce that the trees “planted” virtually through the Czas na Las website are taking root in reality! Thanks to your commitment, seedlings are already growing in the Radomyśl nad Sanem.

1,375 trees native to Poland have been planted. The planting began in the early morning hours in Radomyśl. Trees were funded virtually, through the website czasnalas.pl. After a few hours of planting, the tree planters went on a lunch break. After lunch, they protected the trees from possible gnawing by animals. The planting was completed in the evening, and Poland has become greener. The species biodiversity of Polish forests has also increased.

Also YOU can plant a virtual tree thanks to the website “https://czasnalas.org/”

After the incredible success of our tree-planting last year, in which we tagged over a thousand agroforestry trees that have survived and thrived, we did a small tree-planting this year to be eligible to participate in the “Tree Planting Day” and to demonstrate the very best of our tree-planting techniques.

We created a photo gallery of 10 innovative and fun, science based, micro-techniques we use when planting, to give the trees a fantastic chance of living and producing, without irrigation, on the borders of our vineyard.

These are the ten techniques we share with you:

1) Choose your spot: Within the planned area we chose a spot under a deep layer of natural mulch where the soil remains humid for longer

2) Biochar: We add a small shovel of activated biochar in the hole to increase microbiology and it acts like a sponge retaining water and nutrients.

3) High quality compost: We mis the natural soil with some high quality organic cow manure and mushroom substrate compost from “MyceliOrganic”

4) Smart watering: ⅔ of the water is added to the bottom of the hole, while the tree is loosely in place

5) Add a worm: We added one to each tree!

6) Donut: A small circular ditch at the drip line helps water infiltrate where the roots need it most

7) Compost Tea: We mixed a about 20ml of compost tea with the remaining 2 litres of water for the final watering

8) Cone: This takes the water away from the trunk to encourage roots to grow outwards and be more wind resistant.

9) Seeds: We add perennial cover crop seeds around the tree to create a syntropic relationship.

10) Mulch: We add a light mulch which lets the seeds grow, but keeps direct sun off the soil.

En otra zona del patio, los alumnos de primero(16 alumnos) junto con su tutora y el profesor de educación física plantaron los 2 tilos. Primero hicieron el agujero en la tierra removiendo bien la tierra de alrededor, luego plantaron, tutorizaron y regaron.

This autochthonous plant planting event is the result of a partnership between the Think green, live better project of the Dr. Jaime Magalhães Lima Basic and Secondary School involving 9th grade students and some 11th grade students, who are at the genesis of the project, and the Life Terra project.

This event is organized by Think green, live better, Bioliving https://bioliving.pt/ , Cabeço Santo https://ecosanto.com/, CESAM https://www.cesam-la.pt/en/ and Life Terra. Bioliving and Cabeço Santo are environmental associations dedicated to forest management and conservation, while CESAM is a research center affiliated with the University of Aveiro. "Think green, live better" is a sustainable social entrepreneurship and active citizenship project associated with a group of students from a ninth grade class, 9D and a tenth grade class, 11ºA, from the Dr. Jaime Magalhães Lima Basic and Secondary School (EBSJML). Concerned about the impact of global warming, the students created a nursery of native trees and are planting the resulting saplings in the Aveiro region.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Batonia Beekenbos

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Batonia Beekenbos
fields.event_details: Batonia Beekenbos is a community food forest. Their plan is to produce fresh, delicious and healthy food for approximately 40 households that come to harvest themselves and a number of restaurants in the area. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. In November and early December planting activities were held almost every weekend and occasionally during the week.

De Avonturentuin participated in the Treevember campaign by raising funds to create a food forest on their property. The initiative aims to plant 50 trees and shrubs, providing food, biodiversity, and shelter for people, animals, and pollinators. It supports sustainability and community health.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at De grune grond

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at De grune grond
fields.event_details: In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. During the initiative, an event was organized to plant trees, expand the food forest and increase its biodiversity.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst
fields.event_details: Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst is a community-driven project transforming a field into a 1.1-hectare food forest. In November 2024, Voedselbos Rhenen-Elst participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting over 100 trees and shrubs, including quince, apple, nashi pear, elderberry, and medlar. Funds were also used to purchase materials to give the plants a good start, such as wood chips. A nursery was also set up next to the food forest to propagate plants in the future.

items.name: Treevember event at Voedselbos nabij het Oudeland

fields.event-name: Treevember event at Voedselbos nabij het Oudeland
fields.event_details: Voedselbos nabij het Oudeland is a half-hectare food forest project located in the Netherlands. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. On November 30, 2024, a planting day was organized where volunteers planted fruit trees, berry bushes, and began preparations for the pond. The event fostered community engagement and hands-on learning about sustainable practices.

items.name: Plantación con el Colegio Jaime Balmes en Froxán

fields.event-name: Plantación con el Colegio Jaime Balmes en Froxán
fields.event_details:
El miércoles 15 de Enero disfrutamos de una preciosa jornada de plantación organizada por la Fundación Montescola y ayudados por los estudiantes del Colegio Jaime Balmes de Noia.

Aprovechando el buen tiempo, logramos plantar más de 100 ejemplares de olmo resistente a la grafiosis, contribuyendo a los esfuerzos de restauración que la Fundación Montescola y la aldea de Froxán llevan realizando para recuperar el bosque autóctono de frondosas en una parcela antiguamente invadida por Pino de Monterrey.

¡Gracias a todos los que hicieron posible esta iniciativa!

For our first event of 2025 twenty-five enthuastic students from the school were joined by eight adult volunteers in the winter sunshine to plant 475 native trees and shrubs. Although some surface weeds had rooted in the mulch the soil beneath was relatively warm with lots of worms near the surface. The transition year (TY) students worked really hard and we completed that task in almost record time. Following the event we were treated to tea/coffee and sandwiches. Another Stepping Stone Forest, and the first in 2025 was successfully planted.

fields.event_details:
Voedselbos Lingehout hosted several tree-planting activities that united the community to boost local biodiversity. Volunteers came together to plant a diverse range of tree species, transforming the area into a vibrant and greener space.

Each event saw enthusiastic participation, from families to local organizations, all working toward a shared goal of environmental sustainability. The initiative has left a lasting impact, creating a thriving natural habitat that will benefit future generations.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos De Godin

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at Voedselbos De Godin
fields.event_details: De Godin, Eetbaar Landschap is a 4,000 m² food forest project in the Netherlands, dedicated to creating a space for community engagement, collaboration, and discovery. In November 2024, De Godin participated in Treevember, a campaign organized by The Pollinators, to raise funds for planting. A planting event was scheduled for December 1, 2024, from 13:00 to 16:00, inviting community members to join in the planting activities. Participants were offered coffee, tea, and refreshments during the event.

items.name: Pollinators treevember event at 't Volle Bos

fields.event-name: Pollinators treevember event at 't Volle Bos
fields.event_details: t Volle Bos, a small food forest edge in the Netherlands. In November 2024, the project participated in Treevember, a crowdfunding campaign organized by The Pollinators. On November 23, 2024, a planting day was organized to plant fruit trees, shurubs and herbs to expand the food forest and increase it biodiversity and resilience.
